Typealiases.html#/s:10ActionData8ADRecor.name: ADRecord

Typealiases.html#/s:10ActionData11ADReco.abstract: Defines an array of ADRecord instances that can be sent to or returned from a ADDataProvider or any of the Action Codable controls.

Structs/ADSQLInsertInstruction/Action.ht.name: insertOrReplace

Structs/ADSQLInsertInstruction/Action.ht.abstract: Attempt to insert a new row and fail if the row cannot be created.

Structs/ADSQLInsertInstruction/Action.ht.abstract: Attempt to insert a new row and ignore the issue if the row cannot be created.

Structs/ADSQLInsertInstruction.html#/s:1.abstract: The name of the table that a row is being inserted into.

Structs/ADSQLInsertInstruction.html#/s:1.name: columnNames

Structs/ADSQLInsertInstruction.html#/s:1.name: selectStatement

Structs/ADCrossReference.html#/s:10Actio.name: crossReferenceName
Structs/ADCrossReference.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: The name of the cross reference table.

Structs/ADCrossReference.html#/s:10Actio.name: leftKeyName
Structs/ADCrossReference.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: The name of the left-side key used to store the primary key of the ADDataTable on the left side of the relationship.

Structs/ADCrossReference.html#/s:10Actio.name: rightKeyName
Structs/ADCrossReference.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: The name of the right-side key used to store the primary key of the ADDataTable on the right side of the relationship.

Structs/ADCrossReference.html#/s:10Actio.name: storage
Structs/ADCrossReference.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Stores all child ADDataTable instances that are a part of the cross reference relationship to the left-side primary key value.

Structs/ADCrossReference.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Provides quick access to the items in the storage property.

Structs/ADCrossReference.html#/s:10Actio.name: count
Structs/ADCrossReference.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Returns the number of ADDataTable instances in the cross reference.

Structs/ADCrossReference.html#/s:10Actio.name: init(name:leftKeyName:rightKeyName:)
Structs/ADCrossReference.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Creates a new instance of the ADCrossReference with the given table name and key names.

Structs/ADCrossReference.html#/s:10Actio.name: append(_:)
Structs/ADCrossReference.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Adds the given ADDataTable instance to the cross reference’s storage.

Structs/ADCrossReference.html#/s:10Actio.name: ensureCrossReferenceExists(in:forKeyValue:)
Structs/ADCrossReference.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Ensures the given cross reference table exists in the given data provider and left-side key value and creates it if required.

Structs/ADCrossReference.html#/s:10Actio.name: delete(from:forKeyValue:)
Structs/ADCrossReference.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Removes all cross references for the given key value from the given data provider.

Structs/ADCrossReference.html#/s:10Actio.name: save(to:forKeyValue:)
Structs/ADCrossReference.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Saves the given cross references to the data provider for the give key value. The cross reference table will automatically be created if it doesn’t already exist.

Structs/ADCrossReference.html#/s:10Actio.name: load(from:forKeyValue:)
Structs/ADCrossReference.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Loads all cross referenced ADDataTable instances for the given cross reference based on the given key value.

Structs/ADSQLAlterTableInstruction.html#.abstract: The definition of a columns being added.

Structs/ADSQLUpdateInstruction/Action.ht.name: update
Structs/ADSQLUpdateInstruction/Action.ht.abstract: Attempt to update a row in the table.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Execute SQL (non-query) command with (optional) parameters and return result code.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: query(_:withParameters:)
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Run an SQL query with (parameters) parameters and returns an array of dictionaries where the keys are the column names.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: tableExists(_:)
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Checks to see if the given table exists in the SQLite database.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: countRows(inTable:filteredBy:withParameters:)
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Counts the number of records in a given table, optionally filtered by a given set of contraints where a table represents the base unit of data (for example a SQLite table or JSON node) for the source of the data provider.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: lastIntID(forTable:withKey:)
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Gets the largest used number for the given integer primary key of the given table.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: lastAutoID(forTable:)
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Gets the last auto generated integer ID for the given table.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: registerTableSchema(_:withDefaultValues:)
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Registers the given ADDataTable class schema with the data provider and creates a table for the class if it doesn’t already exist.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: updateTableSchema(_:withDefaultValues:)
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Attempts to modify the data source table schema to match the schema of the given ADDataTable class if the schema has changed. If the table does not exist, it will attempt to be registered with the data source. If any new columns have been added, the default values will be set from the given defaults.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: hasRow(forType:matchingPrimaryKey:)
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Checks to see if a row matching the given primary key exists in the underlying SQLite table.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: rowCount(forType:filterBy:withParameters:)
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Return the count of rows in the table, or the count of rows matching a specific filter criteria, if one was provided.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: make(_:)
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Creates an instance of the given ADDataTable class automatically setting the primaryKey field based on the value of the primaryKeyType.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: makeID(_:)
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Returns a value for the primaryKey field based on the value of the primaryKeyType for a class conforming to the ADDataTable protocol.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: getTableSchema(forTableName:)
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Returns all information about a given table in the data source including all of the columns and their types.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: save(_:)
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Saves the given class conforming to the ADDataTable protocol to the data source. If the data source does not contain a table named in the tableName property, one will be created first. If a record is not on file matching the primaryKey value, a new record will be created, else the existing record will be updated.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: save(_:)
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Saves the given array of class instances conforming to the ADDataTable protocol to the data source. If the data source does not contain a table named in the tableName property, one will be created first. If a record is not on file matching the primaryKey value, a new record will be created, else the existing record will be updated.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: getRows(ofType:fliteredBy:orderedBy:startingAt:limitedTo:withParameters:)
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Returns rows from the data source of the given class type optionally filtered, sorted and limited to a specific range of results.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: getRows(ofType:matchingSQL:withParameters:)
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Returns rows from the data source of the given class type matching the given SQL statement.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: getRow(ofType:forPrimaryKeyValue:)
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Returns a row from the SQLite database of the given class type matching the given primary key value.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: getRow(ofType:atIndex:fliteredBy:orderedBy:withParameters:)
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Returns a row from the data source of the given class type optionally filtered and limited to a specific range of results.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: delete(_:)
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Deletes the row matching the given record from the SQLite database.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: delete(_:)
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Deletes the given set of records from the data source.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: dropTable(_:)
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Drops the underlying table from the data source, completely removing all stored data in the table as well as the table itself.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: beginTransaction()
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Starts an explicit transaction to process a batch of data source changes. Once started, the transaction will remain open until it is either committed (via endTransaction) or rolled-back (via `rollbackTransaction).

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: endTransaction()
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Attempts to commit any chages to the data source and close the current transaction that was opened using beginTransaction.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: rollbackTransaction()
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Ends the current transaction (opened using beginTransaction) and undoes any changes made to the data source since the transaction was opened.

Protocols/ADBindable.html#/s:10ActionDat.name: dataPath
Protocols/ADBindable.html#/s:10ActionDat.abstract: Defines the name of a field from the bound data model or a formula that will be used to populate the control. If the control is editable, this is also the field that the value will be written back to.

Protocols/ADBindable.html#/s:10ActionDat.name: enabledPath
Protocols/ADBindable.html#/s:10ActionDat.abstract: Defines the name of a field from the bound data model or a formula that will be used to enable or disable the control.

Protocols/ADBindable.html#/s:10ActionDat.name: hiddenPath
Protocols/ADBindable.html#/s:10ActionDat.abstract: Defines the name of a field from the bound data model or a formula that will be used to hide or show the control.

Protocols/ADBindable.html#/s:10ActionDat.name: controller
Protocols/ADBindable.html#/s:10ActionDat.abstract: Provides a link to the ADBoundViewController that the control is bound to.

Protocols/ADBindable.html#/s:10ActionDat.name: formID
Protocols/ADBindable.html#/s:10ActionDat.abstract: Provides a unique ID that is assigned to the control when it is bound to a ADBoundViewController.

Protocols/ADBindable.html#/s:10ActionDat.name: isMutable
Protocols/ADBindable.html#/s:10ActionDat.abstract: Returns true if the value of the control can be edited by the user, else returns false.

Protocols/ADBindable.html#/s:10ActionDat.name: setValue(_:)
Protocols/ADBindable.html#/s:10ActionDat.abstract: Populates the control with the given value. The value will automatically be cast to the correct type for the given control.

Protocols/ADBindable.html#/s:10ActionDat.name: setEnabledState(_:)
Protocols/ADBindable.html#/s:10ActionDat.abstract: Sets the enabled/disabled state of the control with the value of the field from the bound data model or forumla.

Protocols/ADBindable.html#/s:10ActionDat.name: setHiddenState(_:)
Protocols/ADBindable.html#/s:10ActionDat.abstract: Sets the visible state of the control with the value of the field from the bound data model or forumla.

Protocols/ADBindable.html#/s:10ActionDat.name: setControlSpecificStates(against:)
Protocols/ADBindable.html#/s:10ActionDat.abstract: Sets any control specific bound states (such as colors) with the values from the given ADRecord.

Protocols/ADBindable.html#/s:10ActionDat.name: getValue()
Protocols/ADBindable.html#/s:10ActionDat.abstract: Gets the value from the bound control in the native type that the control handles. For example: String for a UITextField.

Protocols/ADBindable.html.name: ADBindable
Protocols/ADBindable.html.abstract: User Interface controls that conform to this protocol can be added to a ADBoundViewController Views or SubViews and their values will be automatically set and returned to a data model conforming to the Codable protocol based on the field or formula in a SQL like syntax specified in the dataPath property.

Protocols.html#/s:10ActionData16ADSQLIns.name: ADSQLInstruction
Protocols.html#/s:10ActionData16ADSQLIns.abstract: Holds information about an instruction parsed from a SQL statement.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html.name: ADDataProvider
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html.abstract: Defines an Action Data Provider that can be used to read and write data from a given data source.

Protocols/ADDataTable.html.name: ADDataTable
Protocols/ADDataTable.html.abstract: A class conforming to this protocol defines a unique container that holds the data that can be read from or written to a ADDataProvider source. For example, a ADDataTable can be used represent a SQLite database table, a JSON node or a XML node.

Protocols/ADSQLExpression.html.name: ADSQLExpression
Protocols/ADSQLExpression.html.abstract: Holds information about a expression parsed from a SQL instruction.

Protocols/ADDataCrossReference.html.name: ADDataCrossReference
Protocols/ADDataCrossReference.html.abstract: A class or struct conforming to this protocol can be used to store a one-to-many or many-to-many relationship between ADDataTable records stored in or read from a ADDataProvider instance.

Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:10Acti.name: dataSourceNotOpen
Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:10Acti.abstract: The data provider is attempting to work with a datasource before it has been opened.

Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:10Acti.name: dataSourceCopyFailed
Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:10Acti.abstract: Failed to copy a writable version of the database source from the app’s bundle to the documents directory. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:10Acti.name: dataSourceNotFound
Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:10Acti.abstract: Unable to open the data source from the given location or with the given name.

Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:10Acti.name: unableToOpenDataSource
Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:10Acti.abstract: The data provider was unable to open the given data source.

Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:10Acti.name: failedToDeleteSource
Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:10Acti.abstract: The data provider failed to delete the data source.

Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:10Acti.name: tableNotFound
Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:10Acti.abstract: The data provider does not have the requested table name on file. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:10Acti.name: failedToPrepareSQL
Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:10Acti.abstract: The data provider was unable to prepare the SQL statement for execution while binding the passed set of parameters. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:10Acti.name: parameterCountMismatch
Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:10Acti.abstract: The number of parameters specified in the SQL statement did not match the number of parameters passed to the data provider.

Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:10Acti.name: unableToBindParameter
Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:10Acti.abstract: The data provider was unable to bind a given parameter to the SQL statement. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:10Acti.name: failedToCreateTable
Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:10Acti.abstract: The data provider was unable to create the requested table in the data source. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:10Acti.name: failedToExecuteSQL
Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:10Acti.abstract: The data provider was unable to execute the given SQL statement. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:10Acti.name: failedToUpdateTableSchema
Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:10Acti.abstract: The data provider was unable to update the given table schema to the new version. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:10Acti.name: unableToGetRows
Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:10Acti.abstract: The data provider was unable to fetch the requested row(s) from the data source. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:10Acti.name: batchUpdateFailed
Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:10Acti.abstract: The data provider was unable to complete the given batch update command. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:10Acti.name: missingRequiredValue
Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:10Acti.abstract: While attempting to create or update a table schema, the data provider encountered a nil value. Use either the register or update functions with a fully populated default value class instance (with all values set to a default, non-nil value) to create or update the table schema. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADSQLParseError.html#/s:10ActionDa.name: unknownKeyword
Enums/ADSQLParseError.html#/s:10ActionDa.abstract: The parser encountered an unknown keyword in the SQL Command. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADSQLParseError.html#/s:10ActionDa.name: unknownFunctionName
Enums/ADSQLParseError.html#/s:10ActionDa.abstract: The parser encountered an unknown function name in the SQL Command. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADSQLParseError.html#/s:10ActionDa.name: invalidKeyword
Enums/ADSQLParseError.html#/s:10ActionDa.abstract: The parser encountered an invalid keyword in the SQL Command. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADSQLParseError.html#/s:10ActionDa.name: mismatchedSingleQuotes
Enums/ADSQLParseError.html#/s:10ActionDa.abstract: The parser encountered a value in single quotes that is not properly terminated. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADSQLParseError.html#/s:10ActionDa.name: mismatchedDoubleQuotes
Enums/ADSQLParseError.html#/s:10ActionDa.abstract: The parser encountered a value in double quotes that is not properly terminated. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADSQLParseError.html#/s:10ActionDa.name: mismatchedParenthesis
Enums/ADSQLParseError.html#/s:10ActionDa.abstract: The parser encountered a value in parenthesis that is not properly terminated. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADSQLParseError.html#/s:10ActionDa.name: malformedSQLCommand
Enums/ADSQLParseError.html#/s:10ActionDa.abstract: The parser encountered a value that it was not expecting. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADSQLParseError.html#/s:10ActionDa.name: expectedIntValue
Enums/ADSQLParseError.html#/s:10ActionDa.abstract: The parser expected an integer as the next value. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADMaskedFormatPattern.html#/s:10Ac.name: none
Enums/ADMaskedFormatPattern.html#/s:10Ac.abstract: No character will be output for the given position.

Enums/ADMaskedFormatPattern.html#/s:10Ac.name: number
Enums/ADMaskedFormatPattern.html#/s:10Ac.abstract: The # character represents number that will be shown if a numeric value exists in the character position, else the position will be blank.

Enums/ADMaskedFormatPattern.html#/s:10Ac.name: fixedNumber
Enums/ADMaskedFormatPattern.html#/s:10Ac.abstract: The 0 character represents a fixed number that will show the numeric value for the current character position if one exists or will show 0 if no number exists in the given position.

Enums/ADMaskedFormatPattern.html#/s:10Ac.name: uppercaseLetter
Enums/ADMaskedFormatPattern.html#/s:10Ac.abstract: The X character represents an upper case letter (A-Z).

Enums/ADMaskedFormatPattern.html#/s:10Ac.name: lowercaseLetter
Enums/ADMaskedFormatPattern.html#/s:10Ac.abstract: The x character represents a lower case letter (a-z).

Enums/ADMaskedFormatPattern.html#/s:10Ac.name: letter
Enums/ADMaskedFormatPattern.html#/s:10Ac.abstract: The * character represents any letter, upper or lower case (A-Z or a-z).

Enums/ADMaskedFormatPattern.html#/s:10Ac.name: anyCharacter
Enums/ADMaskedFormatPattern.html#/s:10Ac.abstract: The _ character represents any character that can be typed.

Enums/ADMaskedFormatPattern.html#/s:10Ac.name: litteralCharacter
Enums/ADMaskedFormatPattern.html#/s:10Ac.abstract: Represents a character that will be included in the formatted output.

Enums/ADSQLExecutionError.html#/s:10Acti.name: duplicateTable
Enums/ADSQLExecutionError.html#/s:10Acti.abstract: The table already exists inside of the data store. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADSQLExecutionError.html#/s:10Acti.name: unsupportedCommand
Enums/ADSQLExecutionError.html#/s:10Acti.abstract: The requested SQL command isn’t supported by Action Data or then current Data Provider. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADSQLExecutionError.html#/s:10Acti.name: invalidCommand
Enums/ADSQLExecutionError.html#/s:10Acti.abstract: The requested SQL command isn’t valid in the given context. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADSQLExecutionError.html#/s:10Acti.name: unknownTable
Enums/ADSQLExecutionError.html#/s:10Acti.abstract: The data store doesn’t contain the given table. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADSQLExecutionError.html#/s:10Acti.name: unknownColumn
Enums/ADSQLExecutionError.html#/s:10Acti.abstract: The data store doesn’t contain the given column in the given table. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADSQLExecutionError.html#/s:10Acti.name: syntaxError
Enums/ADSQLExecutionError.html#/s:10Acti.abstract: The data store could not execute the SQL command because it contained a syntax error. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADSQLExecutionError.html#/s:10Acti.name: invalidRecord
Enums/ADSQLExecutionError.html#/s:10Acti.abstract: The ADRecord is not valid for the given data table. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADSQLExecutionError.html#/s:10Acti.name: duplicateRecord
Enums/ADSQLExecutionError.html#/s:10Acti.abstract: A record with the same primary key already exists in the table. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADSQLExecutionError.html#/s:10Acti.name: failedCheckConstraint
Enums/ADSQLExecutionError.html#/s:10Acti.abstract: An attempt to insert or update a record failed due to a CHECK constraint. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADSQLExecutionError.html#/s:10Acti.name: noRowsReturned
Enums/ADSQLExecutionError.html#/s:10Acti.abstract: The SELECT clause in a CREATE statement returned no rows. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADSQLExecutionError.html#/s:10Acti.name: unevenNumberOfParameters
Enums/ADSQLExecutionError.html#/s:10Acti.abstract: The number of parameters (specified by a ? in the SQL statement) did not match the number of parameters provided. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADSQLColumnType.html#/s:10ActionDa.name: nullType
Enums/ADSQLColumnType.html#/s:10ActionDa.abstract: Database NULL is the same as a Swift nil.

Enums/ADSQLColumnType.html#/s:10ActionDa.name: integerType
Enums/ADSQLColumnType.html#/s:10ActionDa.abstract: Holds any type of Swift integer data types (Int, UInt, Int32, etc.)

Enums/ADSQLColumnType.html#/s:10ActionDa.name: colorType
Enums/ADSQLColumnType.html#/s:10ActionDa.abstract: Holds a color definition as a text string in the form #RRGGBBAA.

Enums/ADSQLColumnType.html#/s:10ActionDa.name: blobType
Enums/ADSQLColumnType.html#/s:10ActionDa.abstract: Holds any Swift Data value. To store images, use the Action Utilities toData() method.

Enums/ADSQLColumnType.html#/s:10ActionDa.name: noneType
Enums/ADSQLColumnType.html#/s:10ActionDa.abstract: The database has an undefined type and can hold any type of Swift data.

Enums/ADSQLColumnType.html#/s:10ActionDa.name: get(fromString:)
Enums/ADSQLColumnType.html#/s:10ActionDa.abstract: Attempts to get the type from a string.

Enums/ADSQLColumnType.html#/s:10ActionDa.name: set(fromString:)
Enums/ADSQLColumnType.html#/s:10ActionDa.abstract: Sets the column type from a string value.

Enums/ADDataTableKeyType.html#/s:10Actio.name: uniqueValue
Enums/ADDataTableKeyType.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Specifies that the given primary key must be unique and not already exist for any other key in the data provider’s data source.

Enums/ADDataTableKeyType.html#/s:10Actio.name: autoIncrementingInt
Enums/ADDataTableKeyType.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: For an Int type of primary key, automatically assign a key value when a new row is added to the data provider’s data source.

Enums/ADDataTableKeyType.html#/s:10Actio.name: computedInt
Enums/ADDataTableKeyType.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: For an Int type of primary key, automatically assign a key value when a new row is added to the data provider’s data source by finding the largest used ID number and adding one to it.

Enums/ADDataTableKeyType.html#/s:10Actio.name: autoUUIDString
Enums/ADDataTableKeyType.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: For a String type of primary key, automatically assign a UUID as the key value when a new class conforming to the ADDataTable protocol is created.

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.name: ltrim
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.abstract: Trims any white spaces off of the left side of a string.

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.name: trim
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.abstract: Trims any white spaces off both sides of a string.

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.name: instr
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.abstract: Tests to see if one string contains another.

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.name: replace
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.abstract: Replaces all instances of one string inside another.

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.name: upper
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.abstract: Converts the string to upper case.

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.name: length
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.abstract: Returns the length of the string in characters.

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.name: rtrim
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.abstract: Trims any white spaces off of the right side of the string.

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.name: lower
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.abstract: Converts the string to lower case.

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.name: substr
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.abstract: Returns the requested portion of the string.

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.name: abs
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.abstract: Returns the absolute value of a number.

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.name: max
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.abstract: Returns the maximum value of a group of numbers.

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.name: round
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.abstract: Rounds the given number.

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.name: avg
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.abstract: Returns the average of a group of numbers.

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.name: min
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.abstract: Returns the minimum value of a group of numbers.

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.name: sum
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.abstract: Returns the sum of a group of numbers.

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.name: count
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.abstract: Returns the number of records in a group.

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.name: random
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.abstract: Returns a random number

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.name: date
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.abstract: Returns the date in this format: YYYY-MM-DD.

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.name: julianday
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.abstract: Returns the current date in Julian notation.

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.name: strftime
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.abstract: Formats the date as a string based on a set of formatting instructions.

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.name: datetime
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.abstract: Returns the current date and time in the YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format.

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.name: now
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.abstract: Returns the current date and time.

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.name: time
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.abstract: Returns the time as HH:MM:SS

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.name: coalesce
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.abstract: Accepts two or more arguments and returns the first non-null argument

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.name: lastInsertedRowID
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.abstract: Returns the ID of the last row inserted into any table.

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.name: ifNull
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.abstract: Accepts two or more arguments and returns the first non-null argument.

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.name: nullIf
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.abstract: Returns NULL if any of the passed values are null.

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.name: check
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.abstract: Handles an internal check operation.

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.name: compare
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.abstract: Undocumented

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.name: get(fromString:)
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:10ActionData.abstract: Attempts to return a function type for the given string value.

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html.name: ADSQLFunction
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html.abstract: Defines the type of functions that can be called in a SQL expression.

Enums/ADDataTableKeyType.html.name: ADDataTableKeyType
Enums/ADDataTableKeyType.html.abstract: Defines the type of primary key that has been specified for a class conforming to the ADDataTable protocol.

Enums/ADSQLColumnType.html.name: ADSQLColumnType
Enums/ADSQLColumnType.html.abstract: Defines the type of a column stored in a SQL data source. Currently, these support the same data types as SQLite: NULL, INTEGER, FLOAT, TEXT, BLOB, NONE, DATE and BOOLEAN.

Enums/ADSQLExecutionError.html.name: ADSQLExecutionError
Enums/ADSQLExecutionError.html.abstract: Defines the errors that can be thrown when executing SQL statements.

Enums/ADMaskedFormatPattern.html.name: ADMaskedFormatPattern
Enums/ADMaskedFormatPattern.html.abstract: Holds information about a character pattern read from the formatting string of a ADMaskedStringFormatter. For example: (###) ###-#### for a US phone number.

Enums/ADSQLConflictHandling.html.name: ADSQLConflictHandling
Enums/ADSQLConflictHandling.html.abstract: Defines the type of conflict handling that can be applied to a column or table constraint.

Enums/ADSQLParseError.html.name: ADSQLParseError
Enums/ADSQLParseError.html.abstract: Defines the type of errors that can arise when parsing a SQL command string.

Enums/ADSQLKeyword.html.name: ADSQLKeyword
Enums/ADSQLKeyword.html.abstract: Contains a list of all valid SQL keywords that the ADSQLParser can understand.

Enums/ADDataProviderError.html.name: ADDataProviderError
Enums/ADDataProviderError.html.abstract: Defines the type of errors that can arise when working with a data provider that conforms to the ADDataProvider protocol.

Global Variables.html#/s:10ActionData11S.name: SQLITE_DATE
Global Variables.html#/s:10ActionData11S.abstract: Defines the type for a SQLite Date value.

Classes/ADTableStore.html#/s:10ActionDat.name: schema
Classes/ADTableStore.html#/s:10ActionDat.abstract: Holds the schema defining this table as the columns for each row, the column types and any constraints applied to those columns.

Classes/ADTableStore.html#/s:10ActionDat.name: lastPrimaryKeyValue
Classes/ADTableStore.html#/s:10ActionDat.abstract: Returns the value of the primary key for the last record added to the table. If there are no records in the table or no primary key defined, nil is returned.

Classes/ADTableStore.html#/s:10ActionDat.name: nextAutoIncrementingID
Classes/ADTableStore.html#/s:10ActionDat.abstract: Returns the next ID value for auto incrementing integer primary keys else returns zero (0).

Classes/ADTableStore.html#/s:10ActionDat.name: rows
Classes/ADTableStore.html#/s:10ActionDat.abstract: For data sources that provide in-memory data storage (such as JSON, SPON and XML) this property holds all of the rows in the table as ADRecord objects.

Classes/ADTableStore.html#/s:10ActionDat.name: hasRow(withPrimaryKeyValue:)
Classes/ADTableStore.html#/s:10ActionDat.abstract: Test to see if the table contains a row with the given primary key value.

Classes/ADTableStore.html#/s:10ActionDat.name: insertRow(_:action:)
Classes/ADTableStore.html#/s:10ActionDat.abstract: Attempts to insert the given record in the table.

Classes/ADTableStore.html#/s:10ActionDat.name: validateRecord(_:)
Classes/ADTableStore.html#/s:10ActionDat.abstract: Checks the given record to ensure it is valid in the context of the table.

Classes/ADTableStore.html#/s:10ActionDat.name: findRow(matching:onColumns:)
Classes/ADTableStore.html#/s:10ActionDat.abstract: Returns the first row matching the given record on the given list of columns.

Classes/ADTableStore.html#/s:10ActionDat.name: findRows(matching:onColumns:)
Classes/ADTableStore.html#/s:10ActionDat.abstract: Returns all rows matching the given record on the given list of columns.

Classes/ADTableStore.html#/s:10ActionDat.name: findRow(matching:on:alias:)
Classes/ADTableStore.html#/s:10ActionDat.abstract: Returns the first row matching the values in the given record using the given expression.

Classes/ADTableStore.html#/s:10ActionDat.name: findRows(matching:on:alias:)
Classes/ADTableStore.html#/s:10ActionDat.abstract: Returns the all rows matching the values in the given record using the given expression.

Classes/ADTableStore.html#/s:10ActionDat.name: encode()
Classes/ADTableStore.html#/s:10ActionDat.abstract: Encodes the table store into an Instance Dictionary for storage in a Swift Portable Object Notation (SPON) format.

Classes/ADTableStore.html#/s:10ActionDat.name: decode(fromInstance:)
Classes/ADTableStore.html#/s:10ActionDat.abstract: Decodes the table store from an Instance Dictionary that has been read from a Swift Portable Object Notation (SPON) stream.

Classes/ADBoundTextPicker.html#/c:@M@Act.name: dataPath
Classes/ADBoundTextPicker.html#/c:@M@Act.abstract: The name of the field from the date model or formula (in the SQL syntax) used to populate the value from.

Classes/ADBoundTextPicker.html#/c:@M@Act.name: title
Classes/ADBoundTextPicker.html#/c:@M@Act.abstract: Sets the title that is displayed over the picker view.

Classes/ADBoundTextPicker.html#/c:@M@Act.name: optionValues
Classes/ADBoundTextPicker.html#/c:@M@Act.abstract: Defines a comma separated list of options that will be displayed in the attached picker controller for the user to select from. Updating this property will automatically update the optionList property.

Classes/ADBoundTextPicker.html#/c:@M@Act.name: enabledPath
Classes/ADBoundTextPicker.html#/c:@M@Act.abstract: The name of the field from the date model or forumla (using SQL syntax) used to set the enabled state from.

Classes/ADBoundTextPicker.html#/c:@M@Act.name: hiddenPath
Classes/ADBoundTextPicker.html#/c:@M@Act.abstract: The name of the field from the date model or forumla (using SQL syntax) used to set the hidden state from.

Classes/ADBoundTextPicker.html#/c:@M@Act.name: colorPath
Classes/ADBoundTextPicker.html#/c:@M@Act.abstract: The name of the field from the date model or forumla (using SQL syntax) used to set the text color from.

Classes/ADBoundTextPicker.html#/c:@M@Act.name: liveUpdate
Classes/ADBoundTextPicker.html#/c:@M@Act.abstract: If true this text view cause the parent ADBoundViewController to update the form when the value changes. Works with the onEndEdit property, if it’s true the change will only be sent when the user finishes editing the field, else the change will be sent on individual character changes.

Classes/ADBoundTextPicker.html#/s:10Acti.name: controller
Classes/ADBoundTextPicker.html#/s:10Acti.abstract: Provides a link to the ADBoundViewController that the control is bound to.

Classes/ADBoundTextPicker.html#/s:10Acti.name: formID
Classes/ADBoundTextPicker.html#/s:10Acti.abstract: Provides a unique ID that is assigned to the control when it is bound to a ADBoundViewController.

Classes/ADBoundTextPicker.html#/s:10Acti.name: isMutable
Classes/ADBoundTextPicker.html#/s:10Acti.abstract: Returns true if the value of the control can be edited by the user, else returns false.

Classes/ADBoundTextPicker.html#/s:10Acti.name: optionList
Classes/ADBoundTextPicker.html#/s:10Acti.abstract: Gets or sets the list of options that will be displayed in the picker view when the users edits the field.

Classes/ADBoundTextPicker.html#/s:10Acti.name: setValue(_:)
Classes/ADBoundTextPicker.html#/s:10Acti.abstract: Sets the value of the text field from the given value. If the value is an Int or Float it will be converted to a string. If the value is a Bool it will be converted to the string values of true or false.

Classes/ADBoundTextPicker.html#/s:10Acti.name: setEnabledState(_:)
Classes/ADBoundTextPicker.html#/s:10Acti.abstract: Sets the enabled state of the control from the given value. If the value is an Int or Float, 0 and 1 will be converted to false and true. If the value is a String, yes, on, true, 1 will be converted to true, all other values will result in false.

Classes/ADBoundTextPicker.html#/s:10Acti.name: setHiddenState(_:)
Classes/ADBoundTextPicker.html#/s:10Acti.abstract: Sets the hidden state of the control from the given value. If the value is an Int or Float, 0 and 1 will be converted to false and true. If the value is a String, yes, on, true, 1 will be converted to true, all other values will result in false.

Classes/ADBoundTextPicker.html#/s:10Acti.name: setTextColor(_:)
Classes/ADBoundTextPicker.html#/s:10Acti.abstract: Sets the text color from the given value. If the value is a string, this routine will assume it holds a hex color specification in the form #RRGGBBAA.

Classes/ADBoundTextPicker.html#/s:10Acti.name: setControlSpecificStates(against:)
Classes/ADBoundTextPicker.html#/s:10Acti.abstract: Sets any control specific bound states (such as colors) with the values from the given ADRecord.

Classes/ADBoundTextPicker.html#/s:10Acti.name: getValue()
Classes/ADBoundTextPicker.html#/s:10Acti.abstract: Returns the value of the text field.

Classes/ADBoundSwitch.html#/c:@M@ActionD.name: dataPath
Classes/ADBoundSwitch.html#/c:@M@ActionD.abstract: The name of the field from the date model used to populate the value from.

Classes/ADBoundSwitch.html#/c:@M@ActionD.name: enabledPath
Classes/ADBoundSwitch.html#/c:@M@ActionD.abstract: The name of the field from the date model or forumla (using SQL syntax) used to set the enabled state from.

Classes/ADBoundSwitch.html#/c:@M@ActionD.name: hiddenPath
Classes/ADBoundSwitch.html#/c:@M@ActionD.abstract: The name of the field from the date model or forumla (using SQL syntax) used to set the hidden state from.

Classes/ADBoundSwitch.html#/c:@M@ActionD.name: onColorPath
Classes/ADBoundSwitch.html#/c:@M@ActionD.abstract: The name of the field from the date model or forumla (using SQL syntax) used to set the on tint color from.

Classes/ADBoundSwitch.html#/c:@M@ActionD.name: offColorPath
Classes/ADBoundSwitch.html#/c:@M@ActionD.abstract: The name of the field from the date model or forumla (using SQL syntax) used to set the off tint color from.

Classes/ADBoundSwitch.html#/c:@M@ActionD.name: thumbColorPath
Classes/ADBoundSwitch.html#/c:@M@ActionD.abstract: The name of the field from the date model or forumla (using SQL syntax) used to set the thumb tint color from.

Classes/ADBoundSwitch.html#/c:@M@ActionD.name: liveUpdate
Classes/ADBoundSwitch.html#/c:@M@ActionD.abstract: If true this switch cause the parent ADBoundViewController to update the form as the value changes.

Classes/ADBoundSwitch.html#/s:10ActionDa.name: controller
Classes/ADBoundSwitch.html#/s:10ActionDa.abstract: Provides a link to the ADBoundViewController that the control is bound to.

Classes/ADBoundSwitch.html#/s:10ActionDa.name: formID
Classes/ADBoundSwitch.html#/s:10ActionDa.abstract: Provides a unique ID that is assigned to the control when it is bound to a ADBoundViewController.

Classes/ADBoundSwitch.html#/s:10ActionDa.name: isMutable
Classes/ADBoundSwitch.html#/s:10ActionDa.abstract: Returns true if the value of the control can be edited by the user, else returns false.

Classes/ADBoundSwitch.html#/s:10ActionDa.name: setValue(_:)
Classes/ADBoundSwitch.html#/s:10ActionDa.abstract: Sets the value of the switch from the given value. If the value is an Int or Float it will be converted to a Bool (1 = true and 0 = false. If the value is a String it will be converted to a Bool where the string values of true, yes or 1 = true and the values of "false", "no" or "0" =false`.

Classes/ADBoundSwitch.html#/s:10ActionDa.name: setEnabledState(_:)
Classes/ADBoundSwitch.html#/s:10ActionDa.abstract: Sets the enabled state of the control from the given value. If the value is an Int or Float, 0 and 1 will be converted to false and true. If the value is a String, yes, on, true, 1 will be converted to true, all other values will result in false.

Classes/ADBoundSwitch.html#/s:10ActionDa.name: setHiddenState(_:)
Classes/ADBoundSwitch.html#/s:10ActionDa.abstract: Sets the hidden state of the control from the given value. If the value is an Int or Float, 0 and 1 will be converted to false and true. If the value is a String, yes, on, true, 1 will be converted to true, all other values will result in false.

Classes/ADBoundSwitch.html#/s:10ActionDa.name: setOnColor(_:)
Classes/ADBoundSwitch.html#/s:10ActionDa.abstract: Sets the on color from the given value. If the value is a string, this routine will assume it holds a hex color specification in the form #RRGGBBAA.

Classes/ADBoundSwitch.html#/s:10ActionDa.name: setOffColor(_:)
Classes/ADBoundSwitch.html#/s:10ActionDa.abstract: Sets the off color from the given value. If the value is a string, this routine will assume it holds a hex color specification in the form #RRGGBBAA.

Classes/ADBoundSwitch.html#/s:10ActionDa.name: setThumbColor(_:)
Classes/ADBoundSwitch.html#/s:10ActionDa.abstract: Sets the thumb color from the given value. If the value is a string, this routine will assume it holds a hex color specification in the form #RRGGBBAA.

Classes/ADBoundSwitch.html#/s:10ActionDa.name: setControlSpecificStates(against:)
Classes/ADBoundSwitch.html#/s:10ActionDa.abstract: Sets any control specific bound states (such as colors) with the values from the given ADRecord.

Classes/ADSQLCaseExpression.html#/s:10Ac.name: toValues
Classes/ADSQLCaseExpression.html#/s:10Ac.abstract: The list of value to compare against.

Classes/ADSQLCaseExpression.html#/s:10Ac.name: defaultValue
Classes/ADSQLCaseExpression.html#/s:10Ac.abstract: The default value to return when no values match.

Classes/ADSQLCaseExpression.html#/s:10Ac.name: init(fromInstance:)
Classes/ADSQLCaseExpression.html#/s:10Ac.abstract: Decodes the expression from an Instance Dictionary that has been read from a Swift Portable Object Notation (SPON) stream.

Classes/ADSQLCaseExpression.html#/s:10Ac.name: evaluate(forRecord:)
Classes/ADSQLCaseExpression.html#/s:10Ac.abstract: Evaluates the given expression and returns a result based on the data in the record passed in.

Classes/ADSQLCaseExpression.html#/s:10Ac.name: encode()
Classes/ADSQLCaseExpression.html#/s:10Ac.abstract: Encodes the expression into an Instance Dictionary for storage in a Swift Portable Object Notation (SPON) format.

Classes/ADSQLCaseExpression.html#/s:10Ac.name: decode(fromInstance:)
Classes/ADSQLCaseExpression.html#/s:10Ac.abstract: Decodes the expression from an Instance Dictionary that has been read from a Swift Portable Object Notation (SPON) stream.

Classes/ADSQLParser.html#/s:10ActionData.name: parse(_:)
Classes/ADSQLParser.html#/s:10ActionData.abstract: Attempts to parse the given string into an Action Data SQL DOM. This parser currently supports a subset of SQL commands as defined by SQLite. For exmaple:

Classes/ADSQLParser.html#/s:10ActionData.name: parseResultColumnList()
Classes/ADSQLParser.html#/s:10ActionData.abstract: Parses a list of result columns from a SELECT clause in a SQL instruction.

Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: shared
Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Provides access to a common, shared instance of the ADSQLiteProvider. For app’s that are working with a single SQLite database, they can use this instance instead of creating their own instance of a ADSQLiteProvider.

Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: path
Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Reference to the currently open database path or “” if no database is currently open.

Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: databaseName
Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: The name of the currently open SQLite database or “” if no database is currently open.

Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: databaseVersion
Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Gets the current user-defined version number for the database. This value can be useful in managing data migrations so that you can add new columns to your tables or massage your existing data to suit a new situation.

Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: isOpen
Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Returns true if a SQLite database currently open in the data provider, else returns false.

Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: isReadOnly
Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Returns true if the data provider can write to the currently open SQLite database, else returns false.

Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: knownTables
Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: An array of all tables that have been read from or written to the given data source.

Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: init()
Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Initializes a new instance of a ADSQLiteProvider.

Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: forgetTable(_:)
Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Removes the given table from the list of known table names.

Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: openSource(_:fromBundle:readOnly:)
Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Opens the given SQLite database file for the data provider from either the app’s Document or Bundle directories. If opening a database from the Document directory and it does not exist, the database will automatically be created. If opening a database from the Bundle directory for write access, the database will first be copied to the Document directory (if a copy doesn’t already exist there), and the Document directory copy of the database will be opened.

Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: createSource(_:)
Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Creates the given SQLite database file for the data provider in the app’s Document directory. If the database file already exists, it will be opened instead.

Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: saveSource(_:)
Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Closes the currently open SQLite database, copies it to a new filename and reopens the database under the new name.

Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: persist()
Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: The persist function is used to write in-memory Data Provider content to persistant data storage. This command has no affect on a SQLite database.

Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: closeSource()
Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Close the currently open SQLite database. Before closing the database, the framework automatically takes care of database optimization at frequent intervals by running the following commands:

Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: deleteSource(_:)
Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: For writable databases stored in the app’s document directory, delete the data source with the specified file name.

Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: execute(_:withParameters:)
Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Execute SQL (non-query) command with (optional) parameters and return result code.

Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: query(_:withParameters:)
Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Run an SQL query with (parameters) parameters and returns an array of dictionaries where the keys are the column names.

Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: tableExists(_:)
Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Checks to see if the given table exists in the SQLite database.

Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: countRows(inTable:filteredBy:withParameters:)
Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Counts the number of records in a given SQLite database table, optionally filtered by a given set of contraints.

Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: lastIntID(forTable:withKey:)
Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Gets the largest used number for the given integer primary key of the given table.

Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: lastAutoID(forTable:)
Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Gets the last auto generated integer ID for the given table.

Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: getTableSchema(forTableName:)
Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Returns all information about a given table in the SQLite database including all of the columns and their types.

Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: beginTransaction()
Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Starts an explicit transaction to process a batch of database changes. Once started, the transaction will remain open until it is either committed (via endTransaction) or rolled-back (via `rollbackTransaction).

Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: endTransaction()
Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Attempts to commit any chages to the database and close the current transaction that was opened using beginTransaction.

Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: rollbackTransaction()
Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Ends the current transaction (opened using beginTransaction) and undoes any changes made to the database since the transaction was opened.

Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: registerTableSchema(_:withDefaultValues:)
Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Registers the given ADDataTable class schema with the data provider and creates a table for the class if it doesn’t already exist.

Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: updateTableSchema(_:withDefaultValues:)
Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Attempts to modify the SQLite database table schema to match the schema of the given ADDataTable class if the schema has changed. If the table does not exist, it will attempt to be registered with the database. If any new columns have been added, the default values will be set from the given defaults.

Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: hasRow(forType:matchingPrimaryKey:)
Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Checks to see if a row matching the given primary key exists in the underlying SQLite table.

Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: rowCount(forType:filterBy:withParameters:)
Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Return the count of rows in the table, or the count of rows matching a specific filter criteria, if one was provided.

Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: make(_:)
Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Creates an instance of the given ADDataTable class automatically setting the primaryKey field based on the value of the primaryKeyType.

Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: makeID(_:)
Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Returns a value for the primaryKey field based on the value of the primaryKeyType for a class conforming to the ADDataTable protocol.

Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: save(_:)
Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Saves the given class conforming to the ADDataTable protocol to the database. If the SQLite database does not contain a table named in the tableName property, one will be created first. If a record is not on file matching the primaryKey value, a new record will be created, else the existing record will be updated.

Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: save(_:)
Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Saves the given array of class instances conforming to the ADDataTable protocol to the database. If the SQLite database does not contain a table named in the tableName property, one will be created first. If a record is not on file matching the primaryKey value, a new record will be created, else the existing record will be updated.

Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: getRows(ofType:fliteredBy:orderedBy:startingAt:limitedTo:withParameters:)
Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Returns rows from the SQLite database of the given class type optionally filtered, sorted and limited to a specific range of results.

Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: getRows(ofType:matchingSQL:withParameters:)
Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Returns rows from the SQLite database of the given class type matching the given SQL statement.

Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: getRow(ofType:forPrimaryKeyValue:)
Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Returns a row from the SQLite database of the given class type matching the given primary key value.

Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: getRow(ofType:atIndex:fliteredBy:orderedBy:withParameters:)
Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Returns a row from the SQLite database of the given class type optionally filtered and limited to a specific range of results.

Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: delete(_:)
Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Deletes the row matching the given record from the SQLite database.

Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: delete(_:)
Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Deletes the given set of records from the database.

Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.name: dropTable(_:)
Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html#/s:10Actio.abstract: Drops the underlying table from the SQLite database, completely removing all stored data in the table as well as the table itself.

Classes/ADSQLBinaryExpression/BinaryOper.name: notEqualTo
Classes/ADSQLBinaryExpression/BinaryOper.abstract: Testing to see if two values are not equal.

Classes/ADSQLBinaryExpression/BinaryOper.abstract: Testing to see if one value is greater than or equal to another.

Classes/ADSQLBinaryExpression/BinaryOper.abstract: Testing to see if both values are true.

Classes/ADSQLBinaryExpression/BinaryOper.name: or
Classes/ADSQLBinaryExpression/BinaryOper.abstract: Testing to see if either value is true.

Classes/ADSQLBinaryExpression/BinaryOper.name: like
Classes/ADSQLBinaryExpression/BinaryOper.abstract: See if one value is like another.

Classes/ADSQLBinaryExpression/BinaryOper.name: glob
Classes/ADSQLBinaryExpression/BinaryOper.abstract: See if one value is like another.

Classes/ADSQLBinaryExpression/BinaryOper.name: regexp
Classes/ADSQLBinaryExpression/BinaryOper.abstract: Perform a RegEx operation on a value.

Classes/ADSQLBinaryExpression/BinaryOper.name: BinaryOperation
Classes/ADSQLBinaryExpression/BinaryOper.abstract: Defines the type of binary operation being performed.

Classes/ADSQLBinaryExpression.html#/s:10.name: leftValue
Classes/ADSQLBinaryExpression.html#/s:10.abstract: The left side of the binary expression.

Classes/ADSQLBinaryExpression.html#/s:10.name: operation
Classes/ADSQLBinaryExpression.html#/s:10.abstract: The operation to perform on both values.

Classes/ADSQLBinaryExpression.html#/s:10.name: rightValue
Classes/ADSQLBinaryExpression.html#/s:10.abstract: The right side of the binary expression.

Classes/ADSQLBinaryExpression.html#/s:10.name: negate
Classes/ADSQLBinaryExpression.html#/s:10.abstract: If true, negate a binary value result, else false.

Classes/ADSQLBinaryExpression.html#/s:10.name: init(fromInstance:)

Classes/ADSQLUnaryExpression.html#/s:10A.abstract: Decodes the expression from an Instance Dictionary that has been read from a Swift Portable Object Notation (SPON) stream.

Classes/ADSQLFunctionExpression.html#/s:.name: isAggregate

Classes/ADSQLFunctionExpression.html#/s:.name: init(fromInstance:)

Classes/ADSQLFunctionExpression.html#/s:.name: ensureParameterCount(equals:)

Classes/ADSQLFunctionExpression.html#/s:.name: ensureParameterCount(between:and:)

Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.name: shared
Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.abstract: Provides access to a common, shared instance of the ADSPONProvider. For app’s that are working with a single SPON database, they can use this instance instead of creating their own instance of a ADSPONProvider.

Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.name: path
Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.abstract: Reference to the currently open database path or “” if no database is currently open.

Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.name: databaseName
Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.abstract: The name of the currently open SPON database or “” if no database is currently open.

Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.name: databaseVersion
Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.abstract: Gets the current user-defined version number for the database. This value can be useful in managing data migrations so that you can add new columns to your tables or massage your existing data to suit a new situation.

Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.name: isOpen
Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.abstract: Returns true if a SPON data source is open in-memory, else returns false.

Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.name: isReadOnly
Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.abstract: Returns true if the data provider can write to the currently open SPON database, else returns false.

Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.name: knownTables
Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.abstract: An array of all tables that have been read from or written to the given data source.

Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.name: init()
Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.abstract: Initializes a new instance of a ADSQLiteProvider.

Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.name: forgetTable(_:)
Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.abstract: Removes the given table from the list of known table names.

Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.name: openSource(_:fromBundle:readOnly:)
Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.abstract: Opens the given SPON database file for the data provider from either the app’s Document or Bundle directories. If opening a database from the Document directory and it does not exist, the database will automatically be created. If opening a database from the Bundle directory for write access, the database will first be copied to the Document directory (if a copy doesn’t already exist there), and the Document directory copy of the database will be opened.

Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.name: createSource(_:)
Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.abstract: Creates the given SPON database file for the data provider in the app’s Document directory. If the database file already exists, it will be opened instead.

Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.name: saveSource(_:)
Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.abstract: Saves the SPON database to the given filename.

Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.name: persist()
Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.abstract: Attempts to persist the in-memory data store to disk if the database is open, not read only and was origionally opened from a persistant source.

Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.name: closeSource()
Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.abstract: Attempts to persist and close the currently open SPON database.

Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.name: deleteSource(_:)
Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.abstract: For writable databases stored in the app’s document directory, delete the data source with the specified file name.

Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.name: execute(_:withParameters:)
Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.abstract: Execute SQL (non-query) command with (optional) parameters and return result code.

Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.name: query(_:withParameters:)
Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.abstract: Run an SQL query with (parameters) parameters and returns an array of dictionaries where the keys are the column names.

Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.name: tableExists(_:)
Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.abstract: Checks to see if the given table exists in the SPON database.

Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.name: countRows(inTable:filteredBy:withParameters:)
Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.abstract: Counts the number of records in a given SPON database table, optionally filtered by a given set of contraints.

Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.name: lastIntID(forTable:withKey:)
Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.abstract: Gets the largest used number for the given integer primary key of the given table.

Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.name: lastAutoID(forTable:)
Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.abstract: Gets the last auto generated integer ID for the given table.

Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.name: getTableSchema(forTableName:)
Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.abstract: Returns all information about a given table in the SPON database including all of the columns and their types.

Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.name: beginTransaction()
Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.abstract: Starts an explicit transaction to process a batch of database changes. Once started, the transaction will remain open until it is either committed (via endTransaction) or rolled-back (via rollbackTransaction).

Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.name: endTransaction()
Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.abstract: Attempts to commit any chages to the database and close the current transaction that was opened using beginTransaction.

Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.name: rollbackTransaction()
Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.abstract: Ends the current transaction (opened using beginTransaction) and undoes any changes made to the database since the transaction was opened.

Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.name: registerTableSchema(_:withDefaultValues:)
Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.abstract: Registers the given ADDataTable class schema with the data provider and creates a table for the class if it doesn’t already exist.

Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.name: updateTableSchema(_:withDefaultValues:)
Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.abstract: Attempts to modify the SPON database table schema to match the schema of the given ADDataTable class if the schema has changed. If the table does not exist, it will attempt to be registered with the database. If any new columns have been added, the default values will be set from the given defaults.

Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.name: hasRow(forType:matchingPrimaryKey:)
Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.abstract: Checks to see if a row matching the given primary key exists in the underlying SPON table.

Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.name: rowCount(forType:filterBy:withParameters:)
Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.abstract: Return the count of rows in the table, or the count of rows matching a specific filter criteria, if one was provided.

Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.name: make(_:)
Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.abstract: Creates an instance of the given ADDataTable class automatically setting the primaryKey field based on the value of the primaryKeyType.

Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.name: makeID(_:)
Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.abstract: Returns a value for the primaryKey field based on the value of the primaryKeyType for a class conforming to the ADDataTable protocol.

Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.name: save(_:)
Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.abstract: Saves the given class conforming to the ADDataTable protocol to the database. If the SPON database does not contain a table named in the tableName property, one will be created first. If a record is not on file matching the primaryKey value, a new record will be created, else the existing record will be updated.

Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.name: save(_:)
Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.abstract: Saves the given array of class instances conforming to the ADDataTable protocol to the database. If the SPON database does not contain a table named in the tableName property, one will be created first. If a record is not on file matching the primaryKey value, a new record will be created, else the existing record will be updated.

Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.name: getRows(ofType:fliteredBy:orderedBy:startingAt:limitedTo:withParameters:)
Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.abstract: Returns rows from the SPON database of the given class type optionally filtered, sorted and limited to a specific range of results.

Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.name: getRows(ofType:matchingSQL:withParameters:)
Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.abstract: Returns rows from the SPON database of the given class type matching the given SQL statement.

Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.name: getRow(ofType:forPrimaryKeyValue:)
Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.abstract: Returns a row from the SPON database of the given class type matching the given primary key value.

Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.name: getRow(ofType:atIndex:fliteredBy:orderedBy:withParameters:)
Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.abstract: Returns a row from the SPON database of the given class type optionally filtered and limited to a specific range of results.

Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.name: delete(_:)
Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.abstract: Deletes the row matching the given record from the SPON database.

Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.name: delete(_:)
Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.abstract: Deletes the given set of records from the database.

Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.name: dropTable(_:)
Classes/ADSPONProvider.html#/s:10ActionD.abstract: Drops the underlying table from the SPON database, completely removing all stored data in the table as well as the table itself.

Classes/ADBoundSegmentedControl.html#/c:.name: dataPath
Classes/ADBoundSegmentedControl.html#/c:.abstract: The name of the field from the date model used to populate the value from.

Classes/ADBoundSegmentedControl.html#/c:.name: enabledPath
Classes/ADBoundSegmentedControl.html#/c:.abstract: The name of the field from the date model or forumla (using SQL syntax) used to set the enabled state from.

Classes/ADBoundSegmentedControl.html#/c:.name: hiddenPath
Classes/ADBoundSegmentedControl.html#/c:.abstract: The name of the field from the date model or forumla (using SQL syntax) used to set the hidden state from.

Classes/ADBoundSegmentedControl.html#/c:.name: colorPath
Classes/ADBoundSegmentedControl.html#/c:.abstract: The name of the field from the date model or forumla (using SQL syntax) used to set the tint color from.

Classes/ADBoundSegmentedControl.html#/c:.name: liveUpdate
Classes/ADBoundSegmentedControl.html#/c:.abstract: If true this segmented control causes the parent ADBoundViewController to update the form as the value changes.

Classes/ADBoundSegmentedControl.html#/s:.name: controller
Classes/ADBoundSegmentedControl.html#/s:.abstract: Provides a link to the ADBoundViewController that the control is bound to.

Classes/ADBoundSegmentedControl.html#/s:.name: formID
Classes/ADBoundSegmentedControl.html#/s:.abstract: Provides a unique ID that is assigned to the control when it is bound to a ADBoundViewController.

Classes/ADBoundSegmentedControl.html#/c:.name: byTitle
Classes/ADBoundSegmentedControl.html#/c:.abstract: If true the segment is selected by its title, else it is selected by its integer position.

Classes/ADBoundSegmentedControl.html#/s:.name: isMutable
Classes/ADBoundSegmentedControl.html#/s:.abstract: Returns true if the value of the control can be edited by the user, else returns false.

Classes/ADBoundSegmentedControl.html#/s:.name: setValue(_:)
Classes/ADBoundSegmentedControl.html#/s:.abstract: Sets the selected segment based on the given value and the state of the byTitle property. If byTitle is true, the segment matching the value will be selected, else the value will be used as the integer position of the segment to select.

Classes/ADBoundSegmentedControl.html#/s:.name: setEnabledState(_:)
Classes/ADBoundSegmentedControl.html#/s:.abstract: Sets the enabled state of the control from the given value. If the value is an Int or Float, 0 and 1 will be converted to false and true. If the value is a String, yes, on, true, 1 will be converted to true, all other values will result in false.

Classes/ADBoundSegmentedControl.html#/s:.name: setHiddenState(_:)
Classes/ADBoundSegmentedControl.html#/s:.abstract: Sets the hidden state of the control from the given value. If the value is an Int or Float, 0 and 1 will be converted to false and true. If the value is a String, yes, on, true, 1 will be converted to true, all other values will result in false.

Classes/ADBoundSegmentedControl.html#/s:.name: setTintColor(_:)
Classes/ADBoundSegmentedControl.html#/s:.abstract: Sets the tint color from the given value. If the value is a string, this routine will assume it holds a hex color specification in the form #RRGGBBAA.

Classes/ADBoundSegmentedControl.html#/s:.name: setControlSpecificStates(against:)
Classes/ADBoundSegmentedControl.html#/s:.abstract: Sets any control specific bound states (such as colors) with the values from the given ADRecord.

Classes/ADBoundSegmentedControl.html#/s:.name: getValue()
Classes/ADBoundSegmentedControl.html#/s:.abstract: Returns the value of the selected segment based on the state of the byTitle property. If byTitle is true, the title is returned else the integer position of the selected segment is returned.

Classes/ADInstanceDictionary.html#/s:10A.name: escapeValue(_:)

Classes/ADInstanceDictionary.html#/s:10A.name: unescapeValue(_:)

Classes/ADInstanceDictionary.html#/s:10A.name: decode(_:)

Classes/ADInstanceDictionary.html#/s:10A.name: subTableName

Classes/ADInstanceDictionary.html#/s:10A.name: subTablePrimaryKey

Classes/ADSQLEncoder/DataEncodingStrateg.name: rawData
Classes/ADSQLEncoder/DataEncodingStrateg.abstract: The raw Data instance is encoded in the ADRecord and is handled directly by a SQL Data Provider. This is the default strategy.

Classes/ADSQLEncoder/DateEncodingStrateg.name: rawDate

Classes/ADSQLEncoder/DateEncodingStrateg.abstract: Encode the Date as a UNIX timestamp (as a JSON number).

Classes/ADSQLEncoder/DateEncodingStrateg.name: millisecondsSince1970
Classes/ADSQLEncoder/DateEncodingStrateg.abstract: Encode the Date as UNIX millisecond timestamp (as a JSON number).

Classes/ADSQLEncoder/DateEncodingStrateg.abstract: Encode the Date as an ISO-8601-formatted string (in RFC 3339 format).

Classes/ADSQLEncoder/DateEncodingStrateg.name: formatted
Classes/ADSQLEncoder/DateEncodingStrateg.abstract: Encode the Date as a string formatted by the given formatter.

Classes/ADSQLEncoder/DateEncodingStrateg.name: DateEncodingStrategy
Classes/ADSQLEncoder/DateEncodingStrateg.abstract: The strategy to use for encoding Date values.

Classes/ADSQLEncoder/DataEncodingStrateg.name: DataEncodingStrategy
Classes/ADSQLEncoder/DataEncodingStrateg.abstract: The strategy to use for encoding Data values.

Classes/ADSQLEncoder.html#/s:10ActionDat.name: iso8601Formatter
Classes/ADSQLEncoder.html#/s:10ActionDat.abstract: Shared formatter used to encode a Date as an ISO-8601-formatted string (in RFC 3339 format).

Classes/ADSQLEncoder.html#/s:10ActionDat.name: codingPath
Classes/ADSQLEncoder.html#/s:10ActionDat.abstract: The path to the element currently being encoded.

Classes/ADSQLEncoder.html#/s:10ActionDat.name: userInfo
Classes/ADSQLEncoder.html#/s:10ActionDat.abstract: User specific, additional information to be encoded in the output.

Classes/ADSQLEncoder.html#/s:10ActionDat.name: dateEncodingStrategy
Classes/ADSQLEncoder.html#/s:10ActionDat.abstract: The strategy used to encode Date properties. The default is rawDate which allow the ADSQLiteProvider to handle the date directly.

Classes/ADSQLEncoder.html#/s:10ActionDat.name: dataEncodingStrategy
Classes/ADSQLEncoder.html#/s:10ActionDat.abstract: The strategy used to encode Data or NSData properties. The default is rawData which allow the ADSQLiteProvider to handle the data directly.

Classes/ADSQLEncoder.html#/s:10ActionDat.abstract: Creates a new instance of the encoder.

Classes/ADSQLEncoder.html#/s:10ActionDat.abstract: Encodes a Codable or Encodable class into a ADRecord that can be written into a SQLite database using a ADSQLiteProvider. The result is a dictionary of key/value pairs representing the data currently stored in the class. This encoder will automatically handle URLs and Enums (if the Enum is value based and also marked Codable or Encodable). For example:

Classes/ADSQLEncoder.html#/s:10ActionDat.name: container(keyedBy:)
Classes/ADSQLEncoder.html#/s:10ActionDat.abstract: Returns a key/value encoding container for the given key type.

Classes/ADSQLEncoder.html#/s:10ActionDat.name: box(_:)
Classes/ADSQLEncoder.html#/s:10ActionDat.abstract: Stores any Encodable data type in a format suitable for encoding.

Classes/ADBoundWebView.html#/c:@M@Action.abstract: The name of the field from the date model or forumla (using SQL syntax) used to set the enabled state from.

Classes/ADBoundWebView.html#/s:10ActionD.name: formID

Classes/ADBoundWebView.html#/s:10ActionD.name: isMutable

Classes/ADBoundWebView.html#/s:10ActionD.name: getValue()

Classes/ADUtilities/Comparison.html#/s:1.name: lessThan
Classes/ADUtilities/Comparison.html#/s:1.abstract: The first value is less than the second.

Classes/ADUtilities/Comparison.html#/s:1.name: greaterThan
Classes/ADUtilities/Comparison.html#/s:1.abstract: The first value is greater than the second.

Classes/ADUtilities/Comparison.html#/s:1.name: lessThanOrEqualTo
Classes/ADUtilities/Comparison.html#/s:1.abstract: The first value is less than or equal to the second one.

Classes/ADUtilities/Comparison.html#/s:1.name: greaterThanOrEqualTo
Classes/ADUtilities/Comparison.html#/s:1.abstract: The first value is greater than or equal to the second one.

Classes/ADUtilities/Comparison.html#/s:1.name: contains
Classes/ADUtilities/Comparison.html#/s:1.abstract: The second value is contained inside the first.

Classes/ADUtilities/Comparison.html#/s:1.name: and
Classes/ADUtilities/Comparison.html#/s:1.abstract: Testing to see if both values are true.

Classes/ADUtilities/Comparison.html#/s:1.name: or

Classes/ADUtilities.html#/s:10ActionData.name: compare(_:_:_:)
Classes/ADUtilities.html#/s:10ActionData.abstract: Compares two values of type Any to see if they are equal, not equal, less than, greater than, less than or equal to or greater than or equal to eachother. Both values must be of the same type and internally stored as a Int, Double, Float, String or Bool.

Classes/ADUtilities.html#/s:10ActionData.name: compute(_:_:_:)
Classes/ADUtilities.html#/s:10ActionData.abstract: Calculates the addition, subtraction, multiplication or division of two values of type Any. Both values must be of the same type and internally stored as a Int, Double, Float, String or Bool. String and Bool types support addition only. Additionally, String can be added to any other type and the result is a String with the value appended to it.

Classes/ADUtilities.html#/s:10ActionData.name: cast(_:to:)
Classes/ADUtilities.html#/s:10ActionData.abstract: Attempts to cast the given Any type value to the given SQL Database type.

Classes/ADBoundViewController.html#/s:10.name: record

In between setDataModel and getDataModel function calls, use this property to interact with the values from the data model.
