Classes/ADBoundSlider.html#/s:10ActionDa.abstract: Sets the enabled state of the control from the given value. If the value is an Int or Float, 0 and 1 will be converted to false and true. If the value is a String, yes, on, true, 1 will be converted to true, all other values will result in false.

Classes/ADBoundSlider.html#/s:10ActionDa.name: setHiddenState(_:)
Classes/ADBoundSlider.html#/s:10ActionDa.abstract: Sets the hidden state of the control from the given value. If the value is an Int or Float, 0 and 1 will be converted to false and true. If the value is a String, yes, on, true, 1 will be converted to true, all other values will result in false.

Classes/ADBoundSlider.html#/s:10ActionDa.name: setMinColor(_:)
Classes/ADBoundSlider.html#/s:10ActionDa.abstract: Sets the minimum track color from the given value. If the value is a string, this routine will assume it holds a hex color specification in the form #RRGGBBAA.

Classes/ADBoundSlider.html#/s:10ActionDa.name: setMaxColor(_:)
Classes/ADBoundSlider.html#/s:10ActionDa.abstract: Sets the maximum track color from the given value. If the value is a string, this routine will assume it holds a hex color specification in the form #RRGGBBAA.

Classes/ADBoundSlider.html#/s:10ActionDa.name: setThumbColor(_:)
Classes/ADBoundSlider.html#/s:10ActionDa.abstract: Sets the thumb color from the given value. If the value is a string, this routine will assume it holds a hex color specification in the form #RRGGBBAA.

Classes/ADBoundSlider.html#/s:10ActionDa.name: setControlSpecificStates(against:)
Classes/ADBoundSlider.html#/s:10ActionDa.abstract: Sets any control specific bound states (such as colors) with the values from the given ADRecord.

Classes/ADSQLDecoder/DataDecodingStrateg.name: rawData
Classes/ADSQLDecoder/DataDecodingStrateg.abstract: The raw Data instance is encoded in the ADRecord directly from a SQL Data Provider. This is the default strategy.

Classes/ADSQLDecoder/DateDecodingStrateg.name: rawDate
Classes/ADSQLDecoder/DateDecodingStrateg.abstract: The raw Date instance is encoded in the ADRecord directly from a SQL Data Provider. This is the default strategy.

Classes/ADSQLDecoder/DateDecodingStrateg.name: secondsSince1970
Classes/ADSQLDecoder/DateDecodingStrateg.abstract: Encode the Date as a UNIX timestamp (as a JSON number).

Classes/ADSQLDecoder/DateDecodingStrateg.name: millisecondsSince1970
Classes/ADSQLDecoder/DateDecodingStrateg.abstract: Encode the Date as UNIX millisecond timestamp (as a JSON number).

Classes/ADSQLDecoder/DateDecodingStrateg.name: iso8601
Classes/ADSQLDecoder/DateDecodingStrateg.abstract: Encode the Date as an ISO-8601-formatted string (in RFC 3339 format).

Classes/ADSQLDecoder/DateDecodingStrateg.name: formatted
Classes/ADSQLDecoder/DateDecodingStrateg.abstract: Encode the Date as a string formatted by the given formatter.

Classes/ADSQLDecoder/DateDecodingStrateg.name: DateDecodingStrategy
Classes/ADSQLDecoder/DateDecodingStrateg.abstract: The strategy to use for encoding Date values.

Classes/ADSQLDecoder/DataDecodingStrateg.name: DataDecodingStrategy
Classes/ADSQLDecoder/DataDecodingStrateg.abstract: The strategy to use for encoding Data values.

Classes/ADSQLDecoder.html#/s:10ActionDat.name: sqlObject(in:)
Classes/ADSQLDecoder.html#/s:10ActionDat.abstract: Checks to see if a sqlObject is stored in the given data stream and returns it if it is.

Classes/ADSQLDecoder.html#/s:10ActionDat.name: iso8601Formatter
Classes/ADSQLDecoder.html#/s:10ActionDat.abstract: Shared formatter used to encode a Date as an ISO-8601-formatted string (in RFC 3339 format).

Classes/ADSQLDecoder.html#/s:10ActionDat.name: codingPath
Classes/ADSQLDecoder.html#/s:10ActionDat.abstract: The path to the current value that is being decoded.

Classes/ADSQLDecoder.html#/s:10ActionDat.name: userInfo
Classes/ADSQLDecoder.html#/s:10ActionDat.abstract: User spsecific information that can be used when decoding an item.

Classes/ADSQLDecoder.html#/s:10ActionDat.name: dateDecodingStrategy
Classes/ADSQLDecoder.html#/s:10ActionDat.abstract: The strategy used to decode Date properties. The default is rawDate which allow the ADSQLiteProvider to handle the date directly.

Classes/ADSQLDecoder.html#/s:10ActionDat.name: dataDecodingStrategy
Classes/ADSQLDecoder.html#/s:10ActionDat.abstract: The strategy used to encode Data or NSData properties. The default is rawData which allow the ADSQLiteProvider to handle the data directly.

Classes/ADSQLDecoder.html#/s:10ActionDat.name: init(dateDecodingStrategy:dataDecodingStrategy:)
Classes/ADSQLDecoder.html#/s:10ActionDat.abstract: Creates a new instance of the decoder.

Classes/ADSQLDecoder.html#/s:10ActionDat.name: decode(_:from:)
Classes/ADSQLDecoder.html#/s:10ActionDat.abstract: Decodes a Codable or Decodable class from a ADRecord read from a SQLite database using a ADSQLiteProvider. The result is an instance of the class with the properties set from the database record. This decoder will automatically handle URLs and Enums (if the Enum is value based and also marked Codable or Decodable). For example:

Classes/ADSQLDecoder.html#/s:10ActionDat.name: container(keyedBy:)
Classes/ADSQLDecoder.html#/s:10ActionDat.abstract: Returns the keyed decoding container for the given key type.

Classes/ADBoundLabel.html#/c:@M@ActionDa.name: dataPath
Classes/ADBoundLabel.html#/c:@M@ActionDa.abstract: The name of the field from the date model or forumla (using SQL syntax) used to populate the value from.

Classes/ADBoundLabel.html#/c:@M@ActionDa.name: enabledPath
Classes/ADBoundLabel.html#/c:@M@ActionDa.abstract: The name of the field from the date model or forumla (using SQL syntax) used to set the enabled state from.

Classes/ADBoundLabel.html#/c:@M@ActionDa.name: hiddenPath
Classes/ADBoundLabel.html#/c:@M@ActionDa.abstract: The name of the field from the date model or forumla (using SQL syntax) used to set the hidden state from.

Classes/ADBoundLabel.html#/c:@M@ActionDa.name: colorPath
Classes/ADBoundLabel.html#/c:@M@ActionDa.abstract: The name of the field from the date model or forumla (using SQL syntax) used to set the text color from.

Classes/ADBoundLabel.html#/c:@M@ActionDa.name: formatType
Classes/ADBoundLabel.html#/c:@M@ActionDa.abstract: Defines the type of formatter that will be used to format the value of this text field before it is displayed to the user. The currently supported formats are number, masked or date.

Classes/ADBoundLabel.html#/c:@M@ActionDa.name: formatPattern
Classes/ADBoundLabel.html#/c:@M@ActionDa.abstract: Works with the formatType property to format the value that is displayed to the user based on the pattern given in this string. For example, $###,###.00 for a number or mm/dd/yyyy for a date.

Classes/ADBoundLabel.html#/s:10ActionDat.name: numberFormatter
Classes/ADBoundLabel.html#/s:10ActionDat.abstract: Built-in number formatter used with the formatType and formatPattern properties to automatically format numeric values.

Classes/ADBoundLabel.html#/s:10ActionDat.name: dateFormatter
Classes/ADBoundLabel.html#/s:10ActionDat.abstract: Built-in date formatted used with the formatType and formatPattern properties to automatically format date/time values.

Classes/ADBoundLabel.html#/s:10ActionDat.name: maskedFormatter
Classes/ADBoundLabel.html#/s:10ActionDat.abstract: Built-in masked string formatter used with the formatType and formatPattern properties to automatically format string values.

Classes/ADBoundLabel.html#/s:10ActionDat.name: controller
Classes/ADBoundLabel.html#/s:10ActionDat.abstract: Provides a link to the ADBoundViewController that the control is bound to.

Classes/ADBoundLabel.html#/s:10ActionDat.name: formID
Classes/ADBoundLabel.html#/s:10ActionDat.abstract: Provides a unique ID that is assigned to the control when it is bound to a ADBoundViewController.

Classes/ADBoundLabel.html#/s:10ActionDat.name: isMutable
Classes/ADBoundLabel.html#/s:10ActionDat.abstract: Returns true if the value of the control can be edited by the user, else returns false.

Classes/ADBoundLabel.html#/c:@M@ActionDa.name: init(coder:)
Classes/ADBoundLabel.html#/c:@M@ActionDa.abstract: Initializes a new instance of the control.

Classes/ADBoundLabel.html#/s:10ActionDat.name: setValue(_:)
Classes/ADBoundLabel.html#/s:10ActionDat.abstract: Sets the value of the label from the given value. If the value is an Int or Float it will be converted to a string. If the value is a Bool it will be converted to the string values of true or false. If a formatType and formatPattern have been specified, they will be applied to the value before it is set.

Classes/ADBoundLabel.html#/s:10ActionDat.name: setEnabledState(_:)
Classes/ADBoundLabel.html#/s:10ActionDat.abstract: Sets the enabled state of the control from the given value. If the value is an Int or Float, 0 and 1 will be converted to false and true. If the value is a String, yes, on, true, 1 will be converted to true, all other values will result in false.

Classes/ADBoundLabel.html#/s:10ActionDat.name: setHiddenState(_:)
Classes/ADBoundLabel.html#/s:10ActionDat.abstract: Sets the hidden state of the control from the given value. If the value is an Int or Float, 0 and 1 will be converted to false and true. If the value is a String, yes, on, true, 1 will be converted to true, all other values will result in false.

Classes/ADBoundLabel.html#/s:10ActionDat.name: setTextColor(_:)
Classes/ADBoundLabel.html#/s:10ActionDat.abstract: Sets the text color from the given value. If the value is a string, this routine will assume it holds a hex color specification in the form #RRGGBBAA.

Classes/ADBoundLabel.html#/s:10ActionDat.name: setControlSpecificStates(against:)
Classes/ADBoundLabel.html#/s:10ActionDat.abstract: Sets any control specific bound states (such as colors) with the values from the given ADRecord.

Classes/ADColumnSchema.html#/s:10ActionD.name: type
Classes/ADColumnSchema.html#/s:10ActionD.abstract: The type of the columns sych as TEXT, BOOLEAN, DATE, etc.

Classes/ADColumnSchema.html#/s:10ActionD.name: allowsNull
Classes/ADColumnSchema.html#/s:10ActionD.abstract: true if the value of this column can be null, else false.

Classes/ADColumnSchema.html#/s:10ActionD.name: defaultValue
Classes/ADColumnSchema.html#/s:10ActionD.abstract: The default value for this column if no value is provided during an INSERT or UPDATE operation.

Classes/ADColumnSchema.html#/s:10ActionD.name: isPrimaryKey
Classes/ADColumnSchema.html#/s:10ActionD.abstract: true if this column is the table’s primary key.

Classes/ADColumnSchema.html#/s:10ActionD.name: isKeyUnique
Classes/ADColumnSchema.html#/s:10ActionD.abstract: true if the key value must be unique, else false.

Classes/ADColumnSchema.html#/s:10ActionD.name: autoIncrement
Classes/ADColumnSchema.html#/s:10ActionD.abstract: If the column is a PRIMARY KEY of the INTEGER type, is it automatically incremented when a new row is created in the table.

Classes/ADColumnSchema.html#/s:10ActionD.name: checkExpression
Classes/ADColumnSchema.html#/s:10ActionD.abstract: Holds the expression for a Check constraint.

Classes/ADColumnSchema.html#/s:10ActionD.name: init(fromInstance:)
Classes/ADColumnSchema.html#/s:10ActionD.abstract: Initializes a new ADColumnSchema and sets its initial properties.

Classes/ADColumnSchema.html#/s:10ActionD.name: init(id:name:type:)
Classes/ADColumnSchema.html#/s:10ActionD.abstract: Initializes a new ADColumnSchema and sets its initial properties.

Classes/ADColumnSchema.html#/s:10ActionD.name: init(id:name:type:allowsNull:isPrimaryKey:defaultValue:isKeyUnique:)
Classes/ADColumnSchema.html#/s:10ActionD.abstract: Initializes a new ADColumnSchema and sets its initial properties.

Classes/ADColumnSchema.html#/s:10ActionD.name: encode()
Classes/ADColumnSchema.html#/s:10ActionD.abstract: Encodes the column schema into an Instance Dictionary for storage in a Swift Portable Object Notation (SPON) format.

Classes/ADColumnSchema.html#/s:10ActionD.name: decode(fromInstance:)
Classes/ADColumnSchema.html#/s:10ActionD.abstract: Decodes the column schema from an Instance Dictionary that has been read from a Swift Portable Object Notation (SPON) stream.

Classes/ADColumnSchema.html.name: ADColumnSchema
Classes/ADColumnSchema.html.abstract: Holds all of the schema information about a table schema’s columns as read from a backing data store.

Classes/ADBoundLabel.html.name: ADBoundLabel
Classes/ADBoundLabel.html.abstract: Creates a label that can be bound to a value from a data model that conforms to the Codable protocol when placed on a ADBoundViewController view. Use the dataPath property to specify the field from the bound data model to populate the label from or supply a formula in a SQL like syntax.

Classes/ADSQLDecoder.html.name: ADSQLDecoder
Classes/ADSQLDecoder.html.abstract: Decodes a Codable or Decodable class from a ADRecord read from a SQLite database using a ADSQLiteProvider. The result is an instance of the class with the properties set from the database record. This decoder will automatically handle URLs and Enums (if the Enum is value based and also marked Codable or Decodable).

Classes/ADBoundSlider.html.name: ADBoundSlider
Classes/ADBoundSlider.html.abstract: Creates a slider that can be bound to a value from a data model that conforms to the Codable protocol when placed on a ADBoundViewController view. Use the dataPath property to specify the field from the bound data model to populate the slider’s value from or use a formula in a SQL like syntax.

Classes/ADSQLForeignKeyExpression.html.name: ADSQLForeignKeyExpression
Classes/ADSQLForeignKeyExpression.html.abstract: Defines a foreign key expression used in a SQL statement.

Classes/ADTableSchema.html.name: ADTableSchema
Classes/ADTableSchema.html.abstract: Holds all the information about a table’s schema as read from a backing data store.

Classes/ADSPONEncoder.html.name: ADSPONEncoder
Classes/ADSPONEncoder.html.abstract: Encodes a Codable or Encodable class into a ADRecord that can be written into a SPON database using a ADSPONiteProvider. The result is a dictionary of key/value pairs representing the data currently stored in the class. This encoder will automatically handle URLs and Enums (if the Enum is value based and also marked Codable or Encodable).

Classes/ADSPONDecoder.html.name: ADSPONDecoder
Classes/ADSPONDecoder.html.abstract: Decodes a Codable or Decodable class from a ADRecord read from a SQLite database using a ADSPONiteProvider. The result is an instance of the class with the properties set from the database record. This decoder will automatically handle URLs and Enums (if the Enum is value based and also marked Codable or Decodable).

Classes/ADSQLExpressionBuilder.html.name: ADSQLExpressionBuilder
Classes/ADSQLExpressionBuilder.html.abstract: Helper class to create a ADSQLExpression from a ADInstanceDictionary assembled from a Swift Portable Object Notation (SPON) data stream.

Classes/ADSQLBetweenExpression.html.name: ADSQLBetweenExpression
Classes/ADSQLBetweenExpression.html.abstract: Defines a between expression used in a SQL instruction to test if a value is between two other values.

Classes/ADSQLInExpression.html.name: ADSQLInExpression
Classes/ADSQLInExpression.html.abstract: Defines a in expression used in a SQL instruction to see if a value is in the list of give values.

Classes/ADDataStore.html.name: ADDataStore
Classes/ADDataStore.html.abstract: Represents an in-memory Data Store used to provide SQL ability to data sources that typically do not support SQL (such as JSON or XML). ADDataStore works with ADTableStore to define both the structure of the tables and to contain the rows of data stored in each table. ADDataStore understands a subset of the full SQL instruction set (as known by SQLite).

Classes/ADMaskedStringFormatter.html.name: ADMaskedStringFormatter
Classes/ADMaskedStringFormatter.html.abstract: A ADMaskedStringFormatter takes a formatting string and applies it as a mask to a given string value. For example, applying format string (###) ###-#### to 8085551212 would result in (808) 555-1212. A ADMaskedStringFormatter can also be used to remove a format from a string, using the example above, given (808) 555-1212 would result in 8085551212.

Classes/ADBoundStepper.html.name: ADBoundStepper
Classes/ADBoundStepper.html.abstract: Creates a stepper that can be bound to a value from a data model that conforms to the Codable protocol when placed on a ADBoundViewController view. Use the dataPath property to specify the field from the bound data model to populate the stepper’s value from or a formula in a SQL like syntax.

Classes/ADBoundViewController.html.name: ADBoundViewController
Classes/ADBoundViewController.html.abstract: A ADBoundViewController provides a method to attach it to a data model (any Swift class or structure that conforms to the Codable protocol) and any control conforming to the ADBindable protocol on any View or SubView will automatically be populated with the values from the data model based on the dataPath property of the control. The dataPath must match the name and case of a field on the attached data model or be a formula using a SQL like syntax.

Classes/ADUtilities.html.name: ADUtilities
Classes/ADUtilities.html.abstract: Defines a set of utilities to handle data related issues such as comparing two values of type Any.

Classes/ADBoundWebView.html.name: ADBoundWebView
Classes/ADBoundWebView.html.abstract: Creates a web view that can be bound to a value from a data model that conforms to the Codable protocol when placed on a ADBoundViewController view. Use the dataPath property to specify the field from the bound data model to use as the URL or the HTML data to display in the web view. Use the containsHTML property to decide if the dataPath contains a URL or HTML data.

Classes/ADSQLEncoder.html.name: ADSQLEncoder
Classes/ADSQLEncoder.html.abstract: Encodes a Codable or Encodable class into a ADRecord that can be written into a SQLite database using a ADSQLiteProvider. The result is a dictionary of key/value pairs representing the data currently stored in the class. This encoder will automatically handle URLs and Enums (if the Enum is value based and also marked Codable or Encodable).

Classes/ADInstanceDictionary.html.name: ADInstanceDictionary
Classes/ADInstanceDictionary.html.abstract: Defines a passable dictionary of ADRecord values when encoding or decoding an Action Data class instance. ADInstanceDictionary also introduces support for the new Swift Portable Object Notation (SPON) data format that allows complex data models to be encoded in a portable text string that encodes not only property keys and data, but also includes type information about the encoded data. For example:

Classes/ADBoundSegmentedControl.html.name: ADBoundSegmentedControl
Classes/ADBoundSegmentedControl.html.abstract: Creates a segmented control that can be bound to a value from a data model that conforms to the Codable protocol when placed on a ADBoundViewController view. Use the dataPath property to specify the field from the bound data model to select the segment from or use a formula in a SQL like syntax. Use the byTitle property to decide if the segment is selected by title or integer position.

Classes/ADSPONProvider.html.name: ADSPONProvider
Classes/ADSPONProvider.html.abstract: The ADSPONProvider provides both light-weight, low-level access to data stored in a Swift Portable Object Notation (SPON) database and high-level access via a Object Relationship Management (ORM) model. Use provided functions to read and write data stored in a ADRecord format from and to the database using SQL statements directly.

Classes/ADSQLFunctionExpression.html.name: ADSQLFunctionExpression
Classes/ADSQLFunctionExpression.html.abstract: Defines a function being called in a SQL instruction such as count or sum.

Classes/ADSQLUnaryExpression.html.name: ADSQLUnaryExpression
Classes/ADSQLUnaryExpression.html.abstract: Defines a unary expression used in a SQL instruction such as forcing a value to be positive or negative.

Classes/ADBoundPathProcessor.html.name: ADBoundPathProcessor
Classes/ADBoundPathProcessor.html.abstract: The ADBoundPathProcessor evaluates a given Value Path from a ADBindable control against an ADRecord and returns the result of the valuation. The Value Path can be either the name of a field from the record or a formula in a syntax simular to a SQL SELECT or WHERE clause.

Classes/ADSQLJoinClause.html.name: ADSQLJoinClause
Classes/ADSQLJoinClause.html.abstract: Holds the source table or table group for a SQL SELECT statement. If the type is none this is a single table name and not a join between two (or more) tables.

Classes/ADBoundProgressView.html.name: ADBoundProgressView
Classes/ADBoundProgressView.html.abstract: Creates a progress view that can be bound to a value from a data model that conforms to the Codable protocol when placed on a ADBoundViewController view. Use the dataPath property to specify the field from the bound data model to populate the progress from or a formula in a SQL like syntax.

Classes/ADBoundImageView.html.name: ADBoundImageView
Classes/ADBoundImageView.html.abstract: Creates an image view that can be bound to a value from a data model that conforms to the Codable protocol when placed on a ADBoundViewController view. Use the dataPath property to specify the field from the bound data model to populate the image view from or a formula in a SQL like syntax.

Classes/ADInstanceArray.html.name: ADInstanceArray
Classes/ADInstanceArray.html.abstract: Defines a passable array of values used as temporary storage when encoding or decoding an Action Data class. ADInstanceArray also introduces support for the new Swift Portable Object Notation (SPON) data format that allows complex data models to be encoded in a portable text string that encodes not only property keys and data, but also includes type information about the encoded data. For example:

Classes/ADSQLWhenExpression.html.name: ADSQLWhenExpression
Classes/ADSQLWhenExpression.html.abstract: Defines a when clause using in a CASE clause in a SQL instruction.

Classes/ADBoundTextField.html.name: ADBoundTextField
Classes/ADBoundTextField.html.abstract: Creates a text field that can be bound to a value from a data model that conforms to the Codable protocol when placed on a ADBoundViewController view. Use the dataPath property to specify the field from the bound data model to populate the text field from or use a formula in a SQL like syntax.

Classes/ADBoundTextView.html.name: ADBoundTextView
Classes/ADBoundTextView.html.abstract: Creates a text view that can be bound to a value from a data model that conforms to the Codable protocol when placed on a ADBoundViewController view. Use the dataPath property to specify the field from the bound data model to populate the text view from or a formula in a SQL like syntax.

Classes/AppracatappraLicenseManager.html.name: AppracatappraLicenseManager
Classes/AppracatappraLicenseManager.html.abstract: The Appracatappra License Manager handles verfiying your licensed version of a Appracatappra developer product purchased from our online store. You will need to provide the customer information used to purchase the product, the product license that was sent to you in your purchase receipt and a product activation key. You can generate the activation key at the Activate License page of the Appracatappra, LLC. website. You have a limited number of product activations so please make a copy of your Activation Key and keep it in a safe place.

Classes/ADSQLLiteralExpression.html.name: ADSQLLiteralExpression
Classes/ADSQLLiteralExpression.html.abstract: Defines a literal expression used in a SQL instruction such as a column name, integer value or string constant value.

Classes/ADSQLBinaryExpression.html.name: ADSQLBinaryExpression
Classes/ADSQLBinaryExpression.html.abstract: Defines a binary operation being performed on two expressions in a SQL instruction such as adding two values or comparing two values to see if they are equal.

Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html.name: ADSQLiteProvider
Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html.abstract: The ADSQLiteProvider provides both light-weight, low-level access to data stored in a SQLite database and high-level access via a Object Relationship Management (ORM) model. Use provided functions to read and write data stored in a ADRecord format from and to the database using SQL statements directly.

Classes/ADSQLParser.html.name: ADSQLParser
Classes/ADSQLParser.html.abstract: Parses a SQL statement into an Action Data SQL Document Object Model (DOM). This parser currently supports a subset of SQL commands as defined by SQLite. for example:

Classes/ADSQLCaseExpression.html.name: ADSQLCaseExpression
Classes/ADSQLCaseExpression.html.abstract: Defines a case clause used in a SQL instruction.

Classes/ADBoundSwitch.html.name: ADBoundSwitch
Classes/ADBoundSwitch.html.abstract: Creates a switch that can be bound to a value from a data model that conforms to the Codable protocol when placed on a ADBoundViewController view. Use the dataPath property to specify the field from the bound data model to populate the switch from or a formula in a SQL like syntax.

Classes/ADBoundTextPicker.html.name: ADBoundTextPicker
Classes/ADBoundTextPicker.html.abstract: Creates a text field that can be bound to a value from a data model that conforms to the Codable protocol when placed on a ADBoundViewController view. Use the dataPath property to specify the field from the bound data model to populate the text field from or use a formula in a SQL like syntax. Includes a builtin picker control used to select the value from a list of available values.

Classes/ADTableStore.html.name: ADTableStore
Classes/ADTableStore.html.abstract: Represents an in-memory SQL Data Store table used to hold both the table’s schema and the data it represents.

Global Variables.html.name: Global Variables
Global Variables.html.abstract: The following global variables are available globally.

Typealiases.html.name: Type Aliases
Typealiases.html.abstract: The following type aliases are available globally.
